Predicts body temperatures (operative environmental temperature) of an ectotherm in K.

Source: R/OperativeTemperatureFunctions.R
Tb_CampbellNorman.Rd

Predicts body temperatures (operative environmental temperature) of an ectotherm in K.

Tb_CampbellNorman(
  T_a,
  T_g,
  S,
  alpha_S = 0.7,
  alpha_L = 0.96,
  epsilon = 0.96,
  c_p = 29.3,
  D,
  V
)

Arguments

T_a

is air temperature in K.

T_g

is ground temperature in K.

S

flux density of solar radiation (W m^-2), combining direct, diffuse, and reflected radiation accounting for view factors

alpha_S

is organismal solar absorptivity

alpha_L

is organismal thermal absorptivity, alpha_L=0.965 for lizards (Bartlett & Gates 1967)

epsilon

longwave infrared emissivity of skin (proportion), 0.95 to 1 for most animals (Gates 1980)

c_p

specific heat of air (J mol^-1 K^-1)

D

characteristic dimension of the animal (m)

V

is wind speed in m/s

Value

operative environmental temperature, T_e (K)

Details

Predicts body temperatures (operative environmental temperature) of an ectotherm in K. Uses approximation in Campbell and Norman (1998).

See also

Other biophysical models: Free_or_forced_convection(), Grashof_number_Gates(), Grashof_number(), Nu_from_Gr(), Nu_from_Re(), Nusselt_number(), Prandtl_number(), Qconduction_animal(), Qconduction_substrate(), Qconvection(), Qemitted_thermal_radiation(), Qevaporation(), Qmetabolism_from_mass_temp(), Qmetabolism_from_mass(), Qnet_Gates(), Qradiation_absorbed(), Qthermal_radiation_absorbed(), Reynolds_number(), Tb_Fei(), Tb_Gates2(), Tb_Gates(), Tb_butterfly(), Tb_grasshopper(), Tb_limpetBH(), Tb_limpet(), Tb_lizard(), Tb_mussel(), Tb_salamander_humid(), Tb_snail(), Tbed_mussel(), Tsoil(), actual_vapor_pressure(), boundary_layer_resistance(), external_resistance_to_water_vapor_transfer(), heat_transfer_coefficient_approximation(), heat_transfer_coefficient_simple(), heat_transfer_coefficient(), saturation_vapor_pressure(), saturation_water_vapor_pressure()

Examples

 Tb_CampbellNorman(T_a=303, T_g=303, S=823, alpha_S=0.7, alpha_L=0.96, epsilon=0.96, c_p=29.3, 
   D=0.17, V=1)
#> [1] 332.5574
